reviews.review_msg: This class was quite demanding, but he kept the lectures very interesting (lots of demos) and his explanations were clear. Provides very well organized lecture notes, encourages questions. Very enjoyable class.

For a nervous little man, Professor Haljan gives a pretty good lecture. He doesn't have the command presence of some profs, so other students tend to chat away freely while he's lecturing, but he provides printed notes that mirror his teaching slides, and he presents the material in a clear and informative way.

DeBenedictus is great, sometimes his notation can be confusing but you will learn his style fairly quick. Without a doubt he is one of the best physics profs at SFU. The course will be a lot easier if you have some calculus under your belt but it is not mandatory. This course is highly recommended!
He is euthusiatic in physics. Attend class!!! Dont get frustrated if u screw up ur midterms, he got two marking scheme that are in favour of students, and he scales the marks!!!!
More prof's need to be like him. most profs are great people and, not-so great at teaching. Levon is a great person and a great prof.
Good prof, best of all the professors i've had. He's caring, his midterms are easy. good prof.

My class was one of the first classes Levon taught at SFU. Although sometimes he minimizes his explanation and let Math do the job, which could be difficult sometimes. He sometimes follow the lecture notes too mechanically. However, he's always available for help, a very nice prof. I find him quite approachable, and that helps a lot.

He is the most passionate physics professor you will find. Genuinely loves teaching physics, lovely guy. Class is challenging but his lectures are very clear.  Fair midterm and finals, seemed to be mostly out of his practice questions that he gives before every test. Rarely uses the book.

Dugan is a great prof! Very passionate about physics (particularly particle physics). Very funny and crystal clear lectures. The class was very tough, but he scales accordingly.  Assignments are very difficult. Overall, I'd reccomend this course over PHYS 125 if Dugan is your prof.
He cared a lot about what he talked about and his students. His class was very hard. But I passed.

Really nice guy, really enthused about the material and very knowledgeable.  Unfortunately, highly overestimates the abilities of the class.  Lectures are somewhat baffling, homework is difficult and plentiful.

Very challanging course- but prof really helpful and willing to help with with assignemnts- runs tutorials and always hangs around for a couple hours after for questions- not a course for those not wlling to put in alot of time- but great prep for physics majors. Fun class- lots of cool demos- never had so much fun with liquid nitrogen in my life!!

Prof Hayden seems to genuinely care about students, and enjoy teaching. My one complaint is that he gives very little time for quizzes and midterms, leading to rushing and mistakes. He adjusts grading for the final and later midterms though, so although stressful, the time shouldn't affect marks too much.
Super great lectures, very helpful and passionate about the subject. Difficult class because you really need to know the material
Bro is a grade A yapper. He will talk for an hour without saying a single thing. It's honestly quite impressive. Nice guy though.
avoid at all costs

I really enjoyed taking Phys 126 with him! I found that the pre readings helped make sense of what was being covered in the lecture, and while completing the assignments. He makes a lot of dad jokes which I appreciate. He also schedules lots of office hours, so there are lots of opportunities to reach out and ask for help!

Prof. Dodge was a great teacher for PHYS126. He was very accommodating to suggestions made by the class and tried his best to tailor the class to the students needs. His teaching style was relatively easy to follow given the nature of the content and was a great fit for the level of content taught in PHYS126.

Steve is a great guy, but a so-so prof. He knows his stuff, but expects us to have some level of understanding before even coming to class. He is very accessible outside of class and responds quickly to emails. He is also very lenient with grading/late submissions. EXPECT LOTS OF HW! Overall he is a good choice and this class was pretty good.

Steve is a pretty chill guy overall. I was not a fan of having to read the textbook before coming to lectures. The material is also pretty tough in my opinion, it's quite similar to PHYS 121 but more in detail with the concepts. But he is a pretty nice guy, and he curves quite well, so maybe the class material is at fault, and not him.
Steve makes this course way more approachable

Good prof. His lectures can be hard to follow if you didn't do the pre-reading, but he posts notes online so you can catch up later. Lots of homework, but do it all and you'll be well prepared for the midterms/final.

absolutely sick guy, he's funny and knows his stuff. Really good at making the physics interesting always bringing your attention to neat little concepts you might've overlooked. You'll be expected to read and do quite a bit of homework but you'll also learn a lot.

This guy is a real g. his lectures are surprisingly interesting with him inserting tidbits of physics history and things he actively researches. A great balance of reading and practice with his every-second-day reading, weekly quizzes, and weekly assignments. Great teacher.

I don't know about what other people have to say, but for me he's a great professor. His lectures are engaging, are easy to follow without wanting to fall asleep. He gives lots of homework but it's for the best because you become very knowledgeable about the subject. Do all the textbook problems because his exams are very close to them.
